benchmark_details.name: ConvAbuse: Data, Analysis, and Benchmarks for Nuanced Abuse Detection in Conversational AI
benchmark_details.overview: We present the first English corpus study on abusive language towards three conversational AI systems gathered ‘in the wild’. Our ConvAI dataset reflects fine-grained notions of abuse, as well as views from multiple expert annotators, identifying substantial differences in the distribution of abuse compared to other commonly used datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate research into nuanced abuse detection in conversational AI and improve detection models by providing a detailed dataset and analysis.

data.source: Collected from conversations with three different conversational AI systems: Alana v2, CarbonBot, and ELIZA.
data.annotation: Annotated with a detailed scheme by expert annotators focusing on different types of abuse.

methodology.calculation: Calculated using aggregated labels based on the majority vote of annotators.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in detecting abusive language.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through multiple iterations of annotation and adjustment based on expert feedback.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes responses from diverse demographic backgrounds although not explicitly stated in the details.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data collected followed GDPR guidelines with implied consent.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data collection followed institutional ethics approval.
